definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Obama has never tried to hide his use of a teleprompter.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬從來沒有對於他用提詞器這方面有所避忌。

sentences.english: You were our audience and prompter.
sentences.chinese: 你是我們的觀衆兼提詞員。

sentences.english: The actor needed to be prompted frequently.
sentences.chinese: 那演員需要經常給以提詞。

sentences.english: Will you prompt for us at the next performance ?
sentences.chinese: 下場演出時你給我們提詞好嗎？

sentences.english: Obama could put that on his teleprompter today.
sentences.chinese: 今天，奧巴馬同樣可以把這些話放在他的提詞器上。

sentences.english: I think he's doing just fine without his teleprompter.
sentences.chinese: 我得說我看了他的演講，覺得他不用提詞器也沒啥。

sentences.english: The actor needed to be prompted frequently.

definition: variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to direct a television or radio broadcast/director (TV, radio)
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
sound track/track number (e.g. on a CD)
